title: Augusta County: Mary A. Smiley to Thomas M. Smiley, April 26, 1861
summary: Mary Smiley writes to her brother, requesting longer letters describing his life in camp. Smiley recounts happenings at home, including the formation a home guard to protect against "negroes" and "mean whites," and gives her brother instructions on maintaining his health. Thomas Smiley's mother adds a note at the end of the letter exhorting him to put his faith in God.
keywords: African Americans, Agriculture, Church/Religious Activity, Enlistment, Family, Home Front, American Civil War
